meanings.definition: Having small, raised, crosshatched patterns on the surface for improved grip.
meanings.sent1: The knurled handle of the tool made it easier to hold securely.
meanings.sent2: The knurled surface of the doorknob prevented slipping.
meanings.sent3: The knurled texture of the steering wheel added a fun twist to driving.
meanings.sent4: Her knurled fingertips felt like tiny bumps of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The knurled design etched in my memory like a fingerprint.

meanings.definition: To make small, raised, crosshatched patterns on the surface for improved grip.
meanings.sent1: He carefully knurled the edges of the metal sheet for a better grip.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman knurled the handle of the hammer to enhance its usability.
meanings.sent3: She decided to knurl the surface of the vase for a unique touch.
meanings.sent4: The artist knurled the clay with precision, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sound of knurling echoed in the workshop, a symphony of craftsmanship.
